org.cojen.tupl.ext

Interface TransactionHandler


  • public interface TransactionHandler
    Handler for custom transactional operations. Undo operations are applied to roll back transactions, and redo operations are applied by recovery and replication.
    See Also:
    DatabaseConfig.customTransactionHandler(org.cojen.tupl.ext.TransactionHandler)

    • Method Summary

      • redo

        void redo(Database db,
          Transaction txn,
          byte[] message)
   throws IOException
        Non-transactionally apply an idempotent redo operation.
        Parameters:
        txn - transaction the operation applies to; can be modified
        message - message originally provided to Transaction.customRedo(byte[], long, byte[])
        Throws:
        IOException

      • redo

        void redo(Database db,
          Transaction txn,
          byte[] message,
          long indexId,
          byte[] key)
   throws IOException
        Non-transactionally apply an idempotent redo operation. Locking an index key allows replication to operate concurrently.
        Parameters:
        txn - transaction the operation applies to; can be modified
        message - message originally provided to Transaction.customRedo(byte[], long, byte[])
        indexId - non-zero index for lock acquisition
        key - non-null key which has been locked exclusively
        Throws:
        IOException

      • undo

        void undo(Database db,
          byte[] message)
   throws IOException
        Non-transactionally apply an idempotent undo operation.
        Parameters:
        message - message originally provided to Transaction.customUndo(byte[])
        Throws:
        IOException

      • setCheckpointLock

        default void setCheckpointLock(Database db,
                               Lock lock)
        Called once when the database is opened, providing a shared lock which is later acquired exclusively by checkpoints. Implementation is permitted (but not required) to use this lock for suspending transactional changes when checkpointStart is called. Simply hold the lock when making transactional changes, and then no additional locking is required when checkpointStart is called.

      • checkpointStart

        default Object checkpointStart(Database db)
                        throws IOException
        Called to durably write all changes. Implementation must suspend all transactional changes (although transactions can be left open), and then initiate a concurrent checkpoint. The checkpoint must capture a snapshot of all changes at the point it was initiated, and it does not need to contain any changes afterwards. A recovery sequence rolls back to the last checkpoint, and then it applies all redo operations to catch up. Undo operations are applied only for transactions which did not commit.
        Returns:
        optional object to be passed to checkpointFinish
        Throws:
        IOException

      • checkpointFinish

        default void checkpointFinish(Database db,
                              Object obj)
                       throws IOException
        Wait for a concurrent checkpoint to finish.
        Parameters:
        obj - optional object passed from checkpointStart
        Throws:
        IOException
